intro: Jasione pontica var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed Pontic Jasione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It is native to the Caucasus region and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
